Setting Comparison Options in Visual Diff

By default, Visual Diff considers differences in case, whitespace (tabs, space, carriage returns/line feeds) as differences between files. However, if you prefer to ignore these differences when comparing files, you can do so.

To set comparison options in Visual Diff:

  1. In the Visual Diff window, select Edit > Options from the menu. The Options dialog opens.

  2. Click the Compare tab.

  3. Select the Ignore Case check box to ignore differences in case.

  4. (Cross-Platform client only) Select the Ignore End-of-Line check box to ignore carriage returns and line feeds.

  5. If you are using the Windows client, go to step 6.

    6. If you are using the Cross-Platform client, go to step 7.

  6. (Windows client only) Select the Ignore Whitespace checkbox to ignore differences in whitespace.

  7. (Cross-Platform client only) In the Ignore Whitespace group box, select any of the following:

    • Do not ignore

    • PVCS Style

    • VSS Style

    • Unix diff -b Style

  8. Click OK when your selection of comparison options is complete.
